unnormalised: What are some common healthcare identifiers used in India?
normalised: What are some common healthcare identifiers used in India?

unnormalised: In India's rapidly evolving healthcare landscape, several identifiers play a crucial role in managing patient data and streamlining processes. One of the most prominent is the Ayushman Bharat Health Account (ABHA) ID, a 14-digit number assigned to each citizen under the Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission (ABDM). This acts as a unique identifier across various healthcare providers. You'll often see it written as something like: ABHA: 1234-5678-9012-34.
normalised: In India's rapidly evolving healthcare landscape, several identifiers play a crucial role in managing patient data and streamlining processes. One of the most prominent is the Ayushman Bharat Health Account (A-B-H-A) I-D, a fourteen-digit number assigned to each citizen under the Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission (A-B-D-M). This acts as a unique identifier across various healthcare providers. You'll often see it written as something like: A-B-H-A: one thousand two hundred thirty four dash five thousand six hundred seventy eight dash nine thousand twelve dash thirty four.

unnormalised: Beyond ABHA, various insurance schemes utilize their own identifiers. For instance, individuals enrolled in the Employees' State Insurance (ESI) scheme are assigned a unique ESI registration number. This number, often structured as something like 11-123456-78-9012, identifies the insured person and their entitlements under the scheme. Similarly, beneficiaries of the Central Government Health Scheme (CGHS) are issued a CGHS card with a unique ID, perhaps looking like CGHS/DEL/12345.
normalised: Beyond A-B-H-A, various insurance schemes utilize their own identifiers. For instance, individuals enrolled in the Employees' State Insurance (E-S-I) scheme are assigned a unique E-S-I registration number. This number, often structured as something like eleven dash one hundred twenty three thousand four hundred fifty six dash seventy eight dash nine thousand twelve, identifies the insured person and their entitlements under the scheme. Similarly, beneficiaries of the Central Government Health Scheme (C-G-H-S) are issued a C-G-H-S card with a unique I-D, perhaps looking like C-G-H-S slash D-E-L slash one two three four five.

unnormalised: Moreover, individual hospitals and healthcare institutions often maintain their own internal patient identification systems. A patient visiting AIIMS, for instance, may be assigned a unique Medical Record Number (MRN) specific to that institution. This number, possibly formatted as AIIMS/MRN/2024/00001, facilitates tracking of their medical history within that hospital's system. Even smaller clinics typically assign a unique number upon registration; Dr. Sharma's clinic might use a format such as DS/PT/0025.
normalised: Moreover, individual hospitals and healthcare institutions often maintain their own internal patient identification systems. A patient visiting A-I-I-M-S, for instance, may be assigned a unique Medical Record Number (M-R-N) specific to that institution. This number, possibly formatted as A-I-I-M-S slash M-R-N slash two thousand twenty four slash zero zero zero zero one, facilitates tracking of their medical history within that hospital's system. Even smaller clinics typically assign a unique number upon registration; Doctor Sharma's clinic might use a format such as D-S slash P-T slash zero zero two five.

unnormalised: Furthermore, diagnostic labs often generate unique accession numbers for each test conducted, which acts as a vital identifier for specific samples and results. You might see a lab accession number written as LAB/2024/OCT/123. These unique codes ensures accurate mapping of a patient's test result with their profile.
normalised: Furthermore, diagnostic labs often generate unique accession numbers for each test conducted, which acts as a vital identifier for specific samples and results. You might see a lab accession number written as L-A-B slash two thousand twenty four slash O-C-T slash one two three. These unique codes ensures accurate mapping of a patient's test result with their profile.

unnormalised: It's important to note that the standardization and interoperability of these identifiers are key goals of the ABDM. While many systems exist, the ABHA ID is envisioned as a central unifying element, enabling seamless data exchange and improved patient care across the Indian healthcare ecosystem.
normalised: It's important to note that the standardization and interoperability of these identifiers are key goals of the A-B-D-M. While many systems exist, the A-B-H-A I-D is envisioned as a central unifying element, enabling seamless data exchange and improved patient care across the Indian healthcare ecosystem.
